name: Bloo Kid 2
description: Bloo Kid 2 is a classic 2D retro-style platformer experience with lovely designed pixel-graphics and a full chiptune soundtrack. Run, jump and swim your way through five huge worlds with twelve levels each. Master brutal bossfights and discover lots of secrets in the world of Bloo Kid 2.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP / Vista / Win7 / Win8 Processor: 1GHz Memory: 128 MB RAM Storage: 40 MB available space Additional Notes: gamepad recommended

reviews.review_text: What a blast from the past! Fun old-school side-scrolling platformer covered with great soundtrack. Fun is guaranteed!

What an awesome platformer! They absolutely nailed the feel of the controls, which is so important in this genre. I only played on easy but the difficulty seemed perfectly balanced, and there are 3 other difficulty levels if you are more of a hardcore player (Nightmare difficulty has to be unlocked by beating the game). Graphics and sound are both great, can't think of anything wrong with this game, bring on bloo kid 3!

For those who love 2D platformer-style back, Bloo Kid 2 is a required purchase, considering the price. The levels are replayable without problems, beautiful graphics as well as the old-style gameplay.   (Below is the Italian full review)

If you like platformers, chip tune soundtracks, and 2D graphics, you are in for a treat! pros: -soundtrack is very nice -graphics fit the game very well -challenging levels  cons: -using arrow keys on keyboard is a little challenging, but can be overcome -nothing else, really  Great game overall and fun way to spend time 8/10  Curator review for Vantom giveaways.  Here is our curator page

Eh, it's okay. Would be much better with a run button, v-sync options a duck animation to make things more interesting while adding the tradiitional 'A' button to the down motion when dropping from platforms. The menu is another thing I hate about it. The Angry Birds/Android-sytle options with circular buttons just aren't appealing. The timer, well, I'm OCD so I'm going to be collecting all this stuff and the timer will run out every time. How is that fair? I'm certainly not going back just to get speed records while missing everything, the layout is a linear middle ground, no need for all of that. It's very easy on hard difficulty. And I can't run. I recommend it because the sprites bring back that feel of the SNES era, however, lacking what I previously stated along with possibly the damage animation, it's unfortunately a flop from the '90s. But still playable, especially for youngins' 4/10
Pros:   Nice graphics Nice soundtrack Very accurate game mechanics  Double jump   Cons:   Your mother

Dang fun little classic style platformer, with colorful and vibrant graphics. It is not something too out of the ordinary, but that is probably one of the alluring things about this game. It is quick and easy to pick up and play, and if you want to test yourself, there are 3 different difficulty modes. I have not played ALLOT of this game yet, but this is not that type of game. It is a simple yet very fun game, and it will run on just about any PC. Completely compatible with the Xbox 360 controller. Packs a real punch for the price!

For all that this game lacks in originality from a conceptual standpoint, it more than makes up for with smooth controls, high replay value (multiple difficulties, unlockable challenge levels, an unlockable time attack mode, and %100ing each stages different objectives), solid level design, fair challenges and difficulty, good enemy variety, classic platforming, catchy music, and colorful graphics. I was thoroughly surprised at how good this game turned out to be! Comes highly reccomended! Thumbs up!
Old School side scrolling. Pretty good, simple yet challenging at times with a good sound track and gamepad support. Got it for free but will definitley keep an eye on the next game for this series.
